column4: hi i've found out how to activate console-completion in a normal debian version... but sowehow it does not work with ubuntu...
nah, but it's fun to look at anyhow. ;)
haha :) make a copy of the bash.bashrc in the /etc folder
ok now delete the old bash.bashrc
then you got to exit the console and log in again... on my computer it works...
this should seriously be implemented; might suggest it.
where can i post this proposal?
breezy is the unstable version; it can break your system. etc etc
i've tried this, but no chance...
